t: Thomas Y. Crowell Co. - Wikipedia
s: August 25, 2024 - In 1909, after Thomas Y. Crowell died, T. Irving Crowell became the company's president. Then in 1937, after T. Irving Crowell retired, the third generation Robert L. Crowell took over and moved towards publishing trade books and biographies.

t: 19th Century Juvenile Series - Thomas Y. Crowell
s: Thomas Y. Crowell (1836-1915) was a native of Massachusetts. In 1856 after several years as a sailor, he joined the Boston bookbindery firm of Benjamin Bradley. Bradley died in 1862 and Crowell ran the company for the estate for three years before becoming a partner with Bradley’s wife in 1865.

t: The LUCILE Project - T. Y. Crowell editions of LUCILE
s: It may now be noted (2022-2023) that Crowell used only one of two sets of electroplates to print ALL of its series and editons of Lucile. The setting in a larger typeface had 269 pages and the first words at the top of (last text) page, 269, were "The moon was ...".

t: Thomas Y. Crowell - Wikipedia
s: February 6, 2025 - Thomas Young Crowell (1836–1915) was an American bookbinder and publisher, the founder of New York City book publishing company Thomas Y. Crowell Co. Crowell operated the bindery of Benjamin Bradley, deceased 1862, and acquired it in 1870. He started publishing in 1876.
